intro: Shorea mollis, commonly known as the white ironwood, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Dipterocarpaceae and is characterized by its dense, heavy wood that is highly valued for its strength and durability. The plant typically grows in lowland and hill dipterocarp forests, reaching heights of up to 40 meters. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a distinct midrib, while its flowers are small and clustered in spikes. Shorea mollis plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
